intro: Itea quizhouensis, commonly known as the Quizhou spirea, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the Hydrangeaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and spring blooms. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to woodland gardens and shaded landscapes.
